    古今图书集成医部全录卷四百十一

    小儿头面耳目鼻病门

    　　　　千金方 【唐　孙思邈】

    　　　　　头疮

    　　论曰：小儿头生小疮，浸淫疽痒，黄膏出，不生痂，连年不瘥者，名妒头疮。以赤龙皮汤及天麻汤洗之，内服漏芦汤，外宜敷飞乌膏散，及黄连胡粉水银膏散。
    　　　　小儿直诀 【宋　钱乙】

    　　　　　解颅

    　　解颅者，生下顖门不合也，长必多愁少笑，目白睛多，面色晃白，肢体消瘦，皆肾虚也。　　 【注　按肾主髓，脑为髓之海，前证因父母精血不足，不能荣养，宜用地黄丸补之。有至七八岁或十四五岁，气血既盛而自合。若纵恣饮食色欲，戕贼真阴，亦不能尽其寿矣。此证若在乳下，当兼补其母，更以软帛紧束儿首，使其易合。亦有顖陷顖填，俱属禀不足。或五疳久病，元气亏损者，仍参后小便不通类主之。】[1p]

    Collection of Medical Works from Antiquity to Present, Volume 411

    Diseases of Children's Heads, Faces, Ears, Eyes, and Noses

    From "Thousand Gold Prescriptions" by Sun Simiao (Tang Dynasty)

    Head Sores

    It is said: For children with small sores on their heads, which are itchy and oozing yellow pus, and do not scab over, persisting for years without healing, are called "jealous head sores." These should be washed with Red Dragon Skin Decoction and Tianma Decoction, taken internally with Liu Lu Decoction, and externally treated with Fei Wu Gao San and Huanglian Hu Fen Mercury Gao San.

    Children's Direct Prescriptions by Qian Yi (Song Dynasty)

    Unhealed Fontanelle

    Unhealed fontanelle refers to the incomplete closure of the fontanelle at birth. Such children generally tend to be more sorrowful than joyful; their sclerae are often too prominent, their faces pale and washed out, and their bodies lean, all indicative of kidney deficiency.

    (Note: The kidneys govern marrow, and the brain is considered the sea of marrow. The aforementioned condition arises when the parents' essence and blood are insufficient to nourish the child, and it is advisable to use Di Huang Wan to replenish them. If the child reaches seven or eight years old, or fourteen or fifteen years old, when Qi and blood are strong and the fontanelle naturally closes, they may be fine. However, if indulging in food and desires depletes true Yin, their lifespan cannot be fully realized. If this condition presents in infants, the mother should also be nourished, and the child's head should be tightly wrapped in soft cloth to facilitate closure. There may also be cases of recessed or filled fontanelles, both falling under insufficient constitution. Additionally, those suffering from lingering Five Taxations with depleted vital energy should also be monitored along with similar symptoms of urinary difficulty.)[1p]

    　　　　　发迟

    　　发久不生，生则不黑，皆胎弱也。
    　　【注　前证即五迟之一证也。发者，肾之荣也。良由父母精血不足，肾气虚弱，不能养荣而然耳。】
    　　　　儒门事亲 【元　张从政】

    　　　　　甜疮

    　　凡小儿甜疮久不愈者，俗呼为香疮是也，多在面部两耳前。一法令母口中嚼白米成膏子，临卧涂之，不过三五上则愈矣。小儿并母皆忌鸡、猪、鱼、兔、酒、酢、动风发热之物。如治甜指，亦同此法。
    　　　　　面上疮

    　　凡小儿面上疮谓眉炼疮，耳上谓之辄耳，足上疮谓靴癣。此三者一究其本，皆谬名也。经曰：诸痛疮疡皆属心火。乃血热剧而致然也。或谓：《内经》曰大概，不可使热以为皆然。此不明造化之道也，慎勿妄信。可用(金非)针刺之出血，一次不愈，当复刺之；再刺不愈，则三刺必愈矣。《内经》曰：血实者决之。眉炼不可用药敷之。以其疮多痒，痒则爬矣；药入眼，则目必损矣。[2p]

    Late Hair Growth

    If hair takes a long time to grow, and when it does, it is not black, it indicates weakness of the fetus.
    Note: This is one of the five signs of late development. Hair is a manifestation of kidney vitality. This is mainly due to insufficient essence and blood from the parents, leading to weak kidney energy that cannot nourish the hair.

    Sweet Sores

    In children, if sweet sores do not heal for a long time, they are commonly called “fragrant sores,” mainly appearing on the face and in front of the ears. One method is to have the mother chew white rice into a paste and apply it before sleeping; it should heal in three to five applications. Both the child and mother should avoid chicken, pork, fish, rabbit, wine, vinegar, and anything that induces heat and wind. The treatment for sweet fingers follows the same method.

    Facial Sores

    Facial sores in children are referred to as eyebrow sores; ear sores are called ear sores; and foot sores are known as shoe fungi. These three terms, when examined, are all misnomers. The classics say: all painful sores are related to heart heat, resulting from severe blood heat. Some say: The “Internal Classic” states that generally, heat should not be assumed to apply to all cases. This is a misunderstanding of the way of nature; care should be taken not to be misled. A gold needle may be used to prick for blood; if it does not heal after one attempt, it should be pricked again. If it still does not heal after the second attempt, it will surely heal after the third attempt. The “Internal Classic” states: Blood that is abundant should be pricked. Eyebrow sores should not be treated with medicine, as they are often itchy; scratching may occur, and if the medicine gets into the eyes, it will cause damage.[2p]

    　　　　　白秃疮

    　　夫小儿白秃疮者，俗呼为鸡粪秃者是也。可用甜瓜蔓龙头，不以多少，河水浸之一宿，以砂锅熬取极苦汁，滤去瓜蔓，以文武慢火熬成如稀饧状，盛于磁器中，可先剃头去尽疮痂，死血出尽，着河水洗净，却用熬下瓜蔓膏子一小盏，加半夏末二钱，生姜自然汁一两匙，狗胆一枚同调，不过三两上立可。大忌鸡、猪、鱼、兔、动风发热之物。
    　　　　　目疾

    　　《内经》曰：热胜则肿。治火之法，在药则咸寒，吐之下之；在针则神庭、上星、顖会、前顶、百会。血之翳者可使立退，痛者可使立已，眛者可使立明，肿者可使立消。惟小儿不可刺顖会，为肉分浅薄，恐伤其骨。然小儿水在上，火在下，故目明。
    　　　　　疮疤入眼

    　　小儿疮疤入眼者，乃余热不散耳。止宜降心火，泻肝风，益肾水，则愈矣。
    　　　　　疳眼

    　　夫小儿疳眼数日不开者，乃肝木风热之致然也。可调服凉膈散数服，眼开而愈。[3p]

    White Scalp

    The condition known as white scalp in children is commonly referred to as chicken dung baldness. One can use sweet melon vines and dragon head; there is no specific quantity required. Soak them in river water overnight, then boil in a clay pot to extract the extremely bitter juice. After filtering out the melon vines, use low heat to reduce it to a syrupy consistency and store it in ceramic containers. Before application, shave the head to remove all scabs and dead blood, then cleanse with river water. Afterward, take a small cup of the prepared melon vine extract, add two qian of fresh pinellia powder, one tablespoon of natural ginger juice, and one piece of dog bile together to mix. A dosage of just three qian is sufficient. It is crucial to avoid chicken, pork, fish, rabbit, and any foods that induce heat or wind.

    Eye Disorders

    The "Inner Canon" states: "When heat prevails, there is swelling." To treat fire, the method involves using salty and cool medicines; emesis and purging are also effective. For acupuncture, target Shen Ting, Shang Xing, Yin Hui, Qian Ding, and Bai Hui points. Conditions like blood cloudiness can be quickly alleviated; pain can be promptly relieved; obscured vision can be restored; and swelling can be diminished. However, acupuncture should not be performed on the Yin Hui point in children, as the flesh is too thin and may damage the bones. Children’s conditions are governed by the water above and fire below, hence clear vision.

    Scabs in the Eye

    If a child's scabs enter the eye, it is due to residual heat not dissipating. The appropriate course of action is to reduce heart fire, drain liver wind, and nourish kidney water, leading to recovery.

    Malnutrition Eye

    If a child's malnutrition-related eye condition does not improve for several days, it is caused by wind-heat from the liver. Administering Liang Ge San in several doses will aid in opening the eyes and promote healing.[3p]

    　　　　平治会萃 【元　朱震亨】

    　　　　　解颅

    　　解颅者，乃是母气虚，与热多耳。戴云：初生小儿头上骨未合而开者，宜以四君子汤、四物汤，有热加酒，芩、炒黄连、生甘草煎服；外以绢帛系紧，用白蔹末敷之。
    　　　　　头癞

    　　小儿头癞，用红炭焠长流水，令热洗之。又服酒制通圣散，除大黄酒炒外，以胡荽子、伏龙肝、悬龙尾、黄连、白矾为末调敷。
    　　　　奇效良方 【明　方贤】

    　　　　　解颅

    　　顖门乃母气血充实，令儿顖门坚实而耐养；如母多病，气血虚弱，令儿顖门虚软而不实。又后顶顖乃父之精，元气充实，令儿后顶上坚硬而耐养；如父之元气不足，鴆酒多欲，令儿后顶虚孔不坚，亦不寿。如父母俱怯，生下儿女俱不寿。若如此其父母自亦不能保于天年。前顖又曰信门，道家为泥丸，后信名脑后顶门，头中心顶上又名百会穴。华佗看面部诀载甚详。顖与信同音。凡前后信及百会开而虚，名解颅。[4p]

    Resolving Skull Issues

    Resolving skull issues occurs when the mother's energy is weak and there is an excess of heat. According to Dai Yun, for newborns whose skull bones have not yet fused and are open, it is advisable to use the Four Gentlemen Decoction and Four Substances Decoction, adding alcohol for heat, along with prepared cooked rhubarb, Scutellaria, roasted Coptis, and raw licorice, to be taken as a decoction. Externally, tie a silk cloth securely and apply a powder of white lanceolate.

    Head Sores

    For a child's head sores, use red charcoal to wash with flowing water, allowing the heat to cleanse it. Additionally, take a concoction of wine with Tong Sheng San (a traditional formula) while excluding the rhubarb prepared in wine, using ground coriander seeds, dragon’s liver, dragon's tail, Coptis, and white alum to mix into a paste for application.

    Excellent and Effective Methods

    Resolving skull issues relates to the fullness of maternal energy and blood, resulting in a firm and nurturing fontanelle in the child; if the mother is ill and her energy and blood are weak, the child's fontanelle will be soft and less substantial. The posterior fontanelle relates to the paternal essence; if the paternal energy is robust, the child's posterior fontanelle will be firm and nourishing. Conversely, if the father's energy is insufficient, due to excessive desire for drunkenness, the child’s posterior fontanelle will be soft and not durable, leading to a shorter life. If both parents are weak, their offspring will also have shortened lives. In such cases, the parents themselves may struggle to reach their full lifespan. The anterior fontanelle is also known as the "Faith Gate"; in Daoist terms, it is the "Mud Ball," while the posterior fontanelle is referred to as the "Brain Gate." The center of the head is also known as the "Hundred Meetings." Hua Tuo provided detailed insights on facial diagnosis. The terms "fontanelle" and "faith" share the same pronunciation. When either the anterior or posterior fontanelles and the Hundred Meetings are open and weak, it is referred to as resolving skull issues.[4p]

    　　　　　发黄

    　　发乃血之余。母之血气充实，则发黑而光润；如母之血虚，带漏败堕，月事不调，或鴆酒多淫，或母胎有息，令儿发黄焦槁，生疳热疮痍之患。
    　　　　片玉心书 【明　万全】

    　　　　　解颅

    　　肾主骨髓，脊者髓之路，脑者髓之海也。肝之脉与肾脉，内行于脊骨之中，上会于脑。故头破解颅脊疳之病，乃肝肾之风热，子传于母之病也。　　解颅者有二：或生下之后，头缝四破，头皮光急，日渐长大，眼楞紧小，此髓热也。　　又有生下五六个月后，顖门已合而复开者，此等小儿大数难养。肾肝风热之病，宜加味泻青丸主之，所谓实则泻其子也。芦荟泻青丸加黄蘗、黄芩、黄连等分，碾末蜜丸服。　　解颅八物，有热加连。以绵系束，香附、白蔹。[5p]

    Yellowing of Hair

    Hair is the residue of blood. When a mother's blood and qi are plentiful, the hair is black, glossy, and vibrant; if the mother's blood is deficient, leaking, and failing, with menstrual irregularities, excessive indulgence in wine and lust, or if there are issues from the womb, the child's hair becomes yellow, dry, and brittle, leading to sores and boils.

    Headache Relief

    The kidneys govern the bone marrow, the spine is the pathway of the marrow, and the brain is the sea of marrow. The liver vessels and kidney vessels flow internally through the spine and converge in the brain. Hence, conditions affecting the head and pain in the spine are illnesses caused by wind-heat of the liver and kidneys, passed from mother to child. There are two types of headache relief: one occurs shortly after birth with the skull sutures split, the scalp appearing tight and glossy; this is due to heat in the marrow. The other occurs five to six months after birth when the fontanelle closes and then reopens; children of this situation are often difficult to nurture. For illnesses of wind-heat in the kidneys and liver, it is advisable to use a modified Qingpian pill to treat it, as it is to relieve the child. The Qingpian pill should be combined with equal parts of rhubarb, scutellaria, and coptis, ground into powder, formed into honey pills, and taken. The eight ingredients for relieving headaches include heat and additional components. Bind with cotton, including cyperus and white skullcap.[5p]

    　　　　　顖肿

    　　乳食不常饥饱起，寒热积脾气上冲。致成顖肿随轻重，风热相交未易攻。治宜退热疏风证，泻青丸子显神功。
    　　　　　顖陷

    　　泻泄久而气血虚，不能上冲元气亏。狗脊炙黄为细末，鸡卵白调服即愈。药用参苓白朮散，服之顖陷顿能除。
    　　　　　脑疳

    　　脑疳者，小儿生后，生疮成饼，状如覆盘，此风热也。宜加味泻青丸加蔓荆子、白蒺藜炒。
    　　　　　发迟

    　　发乃血之余，肾之苗也。小儿发久不生，虽生不黑而稀，此由肾气衰而血气不足之故也。地黄丸主之。[6p]

    Swelling of the Fontanel

    Due to irregular feeding, hunger and fullness arise, cold and heat accumulate, and the spleen's energy surges upwards. This results in swelling of the fontanel, varying in severity, and it's difficult to treat with the interplay of wind and heat. The treatment should focus on reducing heat and dispelling wind, with the use of the "Xie Qing Wan" for notable effects.

    Sunken Fontanel

    Prolonged diarrhea leads to deficiency of qi and blood, which cannot support the ascending vital energy. Fry dog spine and grind it into a fine powder, mix with egg white, and taking it will lead to recovery. The medicine should consist of "Shen Ling Bai Zhu San," which will alleviate the sunken fontanel effectively.

    Brain Sores

    Brain sores occur shortly after birth in infants, manifesting as wounds forming crusts resembling overturned pancakes, caused by wind and heat. It is advisable to enhance the "Xie Qing Wan" with additional ingredients like Vitex negundo and fried burdock fruit.

    Delayed Hair Growth

    Hair is the surplus of blood and a sprout of the kidneys. If a child’s hair does not grow for a long time, and when it does, it is sparse and not black, this is due to insufficient kidney energy and blood. The "Di Huang Wan" is the prescribed remedy.[6p]

    　　　　育婴家秘 【明　万全】

    　　　　　解颅

    　　儿本虚怯，由胎气不成，则神气不足，目中白睛多，其颅即解，面色混白，此皆难养，纵长不过二八之数。若戒色欲，多不过四旬而亡。　　解颅有二：初生后头骨渐开，此胎气怯弱，肾不足也。有合而复开者，自颅至印堂有破痕可开一分，又有头四破成缝者，此皆解颅。由病后肾虚，水不胜火，火气上蒸，其髓则热，髓热则解，而头骨复分开矣。肾虚者，宜服地黄丸以补肾之不足，调元汤、十全大补汤，母子共服之，以补脾胃，使气血渐实，其颅自合矣。其髓热者，宜通圣散为丸服，去硝不用；外用封顖法，或用软帛紧束。有作巾遮护，久而自合，亦良法也。　　又有儿生后头渐大，头皮赤，眼光小，此脑疳也。乃受父母热毒之气，藏于肾中，上熏于脑，故头大渐红也。此难养，不出二八之数。其未周岁满头生疮结饼，作痒作痛，儿不能忍，日夜啼哭者，亦难养也。宜服前苦参丸，及松皮散敷之。[7p]

    Secrets of Infant Care (Ming Dynasty, Wan Quan)

    Resolving Head Issues

    A child is inherently weak and timid; if the vital energy from the fetus is insufficient, the spirit becomes lacking, resulting in excessive white in the eyes, and the skull appears unlocked, with a pale complexion. Such children are difficult to raise and often do not live beyond eighteen years. If one restrains sexual desires, they may live a little longer but still not surpass forty days.

    There are two types of unlocked skulls: one that gradually opens after birth due to weak fetal energy and insufficient kidney strength. If it closes and then reopens, there may be cracks from the skull to the glabella, which can open slightly. If there are four cracks forming sutures, these are all indications of an unlocked skull. If the child is weak after an illness, with kidney deficiency causing water to overpower fire, the fiery essence rises, resulting in heat in the marrow; when the marrow is hot, it unlocks and the skull separates again. For those with kidney deficiency, it is advisable to take Rehmannia Pills to replenish the kidney's insufficiency, along with "Tiaoyuan Decoction" and "Shiquandabu Decoction" for both mother and child to strengthen the spleen and stomach, gradually solidifying energy and blood so that the skull naturally closes.

    For heat in the marrow, it is recommended to take Tongsheng Powder in pill form, avoiding nitrate; external application of the sealing method on the head may also help, or using a soft cloth to tightly bind it. Covering with a cloth for an extended period can also lead to a good outcome.

    Additionally, some children have heads that grow larger after birth, with red scalp and small eyes; this is known as "brain sore." It results from the heat and toxic energy of the parents contained in the kidneys, which then rises to the brain, causing the head to enlarge and become red. Such conditions are difficult to treat and typically do not extend beyond eighteen years. If the child, before turning one, develops sores and crusts all over the head, experiencing itchiness and pain, leading to inconsolable crying day and night, this too is hard to manage. It is advisable to administer the previously mentioned "苦参丸" (Bitter Herb Pills) and apply "松皮散" (Pine Bark Powder).[7p]

    　　　　　顖填顖陷

    　　顖填顖陷诀云：热甚则肿，虚热则陷。　　顖填者，顖门肿起骨高突也。经云：热甚则肿，由邪火炎上，使清明之气上升而不降。其证有二：以手摸之肿坚实者，此有寒邪在表，腠理闭，寒热不得出，所谓气上冲则坚劲者是也。宜升阳散火汤，此郁则发之也。如摸之其肿虚浮者，此积热在里，熏蒸于上，所谓气上冲则柔软者是也。宜酒制神芎丸，此高则抑之也。一发一下，中病即止。
    　　　　　头疮

    　　头生胞疮者，勿因皮破成疮，脓水不干，头毛粘结，内生虱，痒则抓之，年久不愈，有成癞头。当先去其虱，用石菖蒲煎汤洗之，其虱尽死；待干，用水银、腻粉二味放碗中，以指研匀，入津调湿，指蘸药搽疮上四畔及发内。虱尽去，方用秋牛皮窑口上烟胶不拘多少，松香研末入轻粉少许、雄黄少许，熬热，热油调涂患处。头生软疖者，年久不愈，用紫金丹涂之，效。[8p]

    Swelling and Depression of the Fontanel

    The prescription for swelling and depression of the fontanel states: "Excessive heat causes swelling, while deficient heat causes depression." Swelling at the fontanel means the bone protrudes and swells upward. The classics say: "Excessive heat causes swelling, due to the evil fire rising, causing the clear and bright qi to rise without descending." There are two signs: if the swelling is firm to the touch, this means there is a cold evil on the surface, closing the pores, preventing cold and heat from escaping, which is what is meant by "qi rushing up causes firmness." In this case, one should use the Rising Yang Disperse Fire Decoction; this will resolve the stagnation. If the swelling feels soft and floating upon touch, this indicates accumulated heat within, steaming upward, referred to as "qi rushing up causes softness." The use of a medicinal pill made of alcohol and Xuanwu should be employed to suppress this condition. When an outbreak occurs, the illness will stop immediately.

    Scalp Sores

    For sores on the scalp, do not allow them to become ulcers due to skin breakdown, resulting in pus that does not dry, with hair stuck together and lice breeding within. Scratching due to itching will lead to chronic conditions, resulting in leprosy. First, eliminate the lice by washing with a decoction of Acorus calamus, which will kill all the lice; let it dry, then mix mercury and fine powder in a bowl, grinding them together, and adding some saliva to moisten. Use your finger to dab the medicine onto the sores and within the hair. Once the lice are removed, apply a suitable amount of smoke from the autumn cowhide mixture with rosin, ground into a fine powder, and mixed with a little light powder and realgar, then heated and applied to the affected areas. For soft sores on the scalp that do not heal over time, applying the Purple Gold Pill will be effective.[8p]

    　　　　　发迟

    　　头之有发，犹山之有草木也。发者血之余，发之多寡，由于血之盛衰也。坎为血卦，血者肾之液，发者肾之苗也，故其色黑也。儿发久不生，生不黑者，皆肾虚也。宜地黄丸主之。　　大病后其发成穗，或稀少者，乃津液不足，疳劳之外候也，宜集圣散主之。
    　　　　幼科发挥 【明　万全】

    　　　　　顖陷

    　　顖陷者，谓顖门陷下成坑也。其证有二：经云，陷者下气虚也。大病之后，津液不足，真气下陷，成坑窟者，宜大补元气，调元汤加升麻主之。有脾胃虚弱，饮食减少，脾主肌肉，肉去皮薄，顖门露见，非陷也。宜服肥儿丸、参苓白朮散，补脾胃则能饮食，肌肉自平，顖不露矣。[9p]

    Delayed Hair Growth

    The presence of hair on the head is like the presence of grass and trees on a mountain. Hair is an excess of blood, and its abundance or scarcity depends on the richness or depletion of blood. The hexagram of Kan represents blood; blood is the essence of the kidneys, and hair is a sprout of the kidneys, which is why it is black in color. If a child's hair does not grow for a long time or is not black when it does, this indicates kidney deficiency. It is advisable to use the Rehmannia Glutinosa Pill as treatment. After a serious illness, if the hair appears in tufts or is sparse, this indicates insufficient body fluids, resulting from malnourishment. It is recommended to use the Gathered Holy Powder as treatment.

    Depressed Fontanelle

    A depressed fontanelle refers to the depression of the fontanelle creating a pit. There are two signs: the classics say that a depression indicates deficient energy. After a serious illness, when body fluids are insufficient, and true energy sinks down creating a pit, one should greatly replenish original energy and use the Regulate Original Decoction with Cimicifuga. If there is deficiency in the spleen and stomach, leading to a reduced appetite, and as the spleen governs the muscles, when the flesh decreases and the skin becomes thin, the fontanelle may appear protruding, which is not a true depression. In this case, one should take the Fat Baby Pill or Ginseng and Poria Powder to nourish the spleen and stomach so that appetite returns, the muscles become balanced, and the fontanelle no longer protrudes.[9p]

    　　　　　枕陷

    　　又百后枕陷者，《活幼心书》谓其证尤重于顖陷者，此大虚极，百无一活。殊不知此非病也，乃父母之过也。初生儿头骨未合，当用菉豆作枕枕之，常与移动，勿使只在一边，则头骨必正矣。此后枕骨陷下者，乃儿卧日久之所致也。若难养则头骨四破，高下成缝者，皆非寿子也。
    　　　　　颈软

    　　头仰者颈软也。颈者头之茎也，一名天柱骨。颈软者，乃天柱骨不能任元而前后左右倾倒也，此恶病也。其证有二：小儿初生便颈软者，皆胎禀不足，肾气虚弱也。肾主骨，肝主筋，筋不束骨，其骨则折，母能令子虚也。此儿难养，纵长不及四旬。肾气虚矣，宜服地黄丸加当归、续断主之。有因大病之后，头骨不能起者，此血气虚弱也，宜十全大补汤炼蜜丸服。经云：头者，清明之府也。头仰斜敧，神将去矣。凡大病人有是证难治。[10p]

    Concerns Regarding Head Deformities and Neck Weakness

    Head Deformities

    After a hundred days, if the head is flattened, the "Book on Nurturing Young Hearts" states that the condition is more serious than a skull indentation; this is a great void, and there is virtually no chance of survival. One must not see this as a disease but rather a failure of the parents. When a newborn’s skull is not fused, one should use a soft pillow made of mung beans and adjust it frequently; do not allow the head to rest on just one side, for then the skull will surely align properly. If after this the occipital bone is still sunk in, it is due to prolonged sleeping in one position. If it becomes difficult to nurture the child and the skull shows fractures and unevenness, it is not a sign of longevity.

    Neck Weakness

    If the head is tilted backward, it indicates a weak neck. The neck is the stem of the head, also known as the Heavenly Pillar Bone. A weak neck signifies that the Heavenly Pillar Bone cannot maintain the head, causing it to tilt forward, backward, or sideways—a serious condition. The symptoms can be twofold: if a newborn has a weak neck right from birth, it results from insufficient prenatal nourishment and weak kidney energy. The kidneys regulate the bones, while the liver regulates the tendons; when tendons don’t support the bones, fractures can occur, causing the mother to deplete the child's vitality. Such a child is difficult to nurture, rarely living beyond forty years. With kidney energy being weak, it is advisable to use Rehmannia Pills with added Angelica and Dipsacus for treatment. In cases where weakness arises after a severe illness, leading to an inability to hold up the head, it is a sign of deficient blood and energy, and one should take the Totally Restorative Decoction with honey pills. The texts state: the head is the dwelling of clarity and brightness. If the head is tilted or misaligned, the spirit will depart. Generally, individuals suffering from severe illness showing this symptom are difficult to treat.[10p]

    　　　　　疳眼

    　　此证多是饮食炙煿，甘辛积热，以致脾胃成疳上攻，眼目赤濇，乌珠有翳，久渐变白，宜速治疗；若不早除，多成痼疾。初服清热饮，次服五疳丸。
    　　　　婴童百问 【明　鲁伯嗣】

    　　　　　解颅

    　　仲阳谓解颅生下而顖不合，肾气不成也，长必少笑。更有目白睛多，滉白身瘦者，多愁少喜也。余见肾虚证。杨氏曰：小儿年大，头缝开解而不合者，肾主髓，脑为髓海，肾气有亏，脑髓不足，所以头颅开而不能合也。人乏脑髓，如木无根，凡得此者，不远千日。其间亦有数岁，乃成废人。设有此证，不可束手待毙，宜与钱氏地黄丸；仍用南星微炮为末，米醋调敷于绯帛，烘热贴之，亦良法也。柏子仁散、三辛散等剂敷之，尤妙。[11p]

    Kānyǎn (Malnutrition-related Eye Condition)

    This condition is often due to excessive consumption of rich and spicy foods, which accumulates heat and leads to the spleen and stomach being impaired. This causes the eyes to become red and watering, the pupils to develop spots, and eventually to appear white over time, necessitating prompt treatment; otherwise, it may result in chronic disease. Initially, administer a heat-clearing drink, and then follow with Wǔgān Wán (Five Malnutrition Pills).

    Jiělú (Head Unclosed Condition)

    Zhongyang states that the condition of the head being unclosed at birth is due to insufficient kidney energy, which affects the formation of the head, leading to a tendency towards smiling less. Additionally, if the whites of the eyes are prominent and the body is thin, it indicates a disposition towards worry and little joy. I have observed this in cases of kidney deficiency. Yang states: for older infants whose cranial sutures remain open and unjoined, the kidneys govern the marrow, and the brain is considered the sea of marrow; when kidney energy is lacking, the brain and marrow are insufficient, resulting in the inability of the skull to close. A person deficient in brain marrow is like a tree without roots; generally, those with this condition will not survive long. In some cases, it takes several years to become incapacitated. If this condition is present, one should not remain passive; it is advisable to use Qiánshì Dìhuáng Wán (Qian's Rehmannia Pills) and also to prepare a fine powder of Nánxīng (Arisaema), mix it with rice vinegar, and apply it heated on scarlet silk, which is also an effective method. Applying Baiziren San (Platycladus Seed Powder) or Sanxin San (Three Aromatic Powder) is particularly excellent.[11p]

    　　　　　顖陷顖填

    　　顖陷者，始因脏腑有热，渴饮水浆，致成泄利，久则血气虚弱，不能上充脑髓，故顖陷如坑，不能平满。用狗头骨炙黄为末，鸡子清调敷之。顖填者，顖门肿起也。脾主肌肉，乳哺不常，饥饱无度，或寒或热，乘于脾家，致使脏腑不调，其气上冲，为之填胀，顖突而高，如物堆起，毛发短黄自汗是也。若寒气上冲，则牢(革卬) 【音昂，履头也，肿硬如履头突起，】 热气上冲则柔软。寒者温之，热者凉之。剂量轻重，兼与调气。小儿肝盛，风热反攻亦然。此证未易退差。或热证，用大连翘散以消之；有表热证，柴胡散主之；又有封顖散掩之。论曰：小儿胃气冲和，则脑髓充盛，顖顶渐合。若胃热熏蒸脏腑，则渴而引饮，因致泄利，令脏腑壅热，血气虚弱，不能上充脑髓，所以顖陷也。《圣济经》用当归散、地黄丸。[12p]

    Yuan Xian and Yuan Tian

    Yuan Xian refers to the condition where the top of the head sinks. It is primarily caused by internal heat in the organs, leading to thirst and excessive drinking. This, in turn, results in diarrhea, and over time, the blood and energy become weak, unable to nourish the brain marrow. Hence, the top of the head sinks like a pit, not appearing full. To treat this, bone powder from a dog’s skull, roasted to a yellow powder, is mixed with chicken egg white and applied.

    Yuan Tian refers to swelling or protrusion at the top of the head. The spleen governs the muscles, and irregularities in nourishment—be it overfeeding or underfeeding, hot or cold—can lead to imbalances in the internal organs. This causes energy to surge upwards, leading to swelling and protrusion of the head, which appears raised like a pile. When cold energy surges, it is hard and firm, while when hot energy surges, it is soft. If it is cold, apply warmth; if hot, apply cooling. The treatment dosage should be adjusted accordingly.

    For children, if liver energy is excessive, or when wind-heat attacks, the condition may similarly arise. This condition is not easily resolved. For heat symptoms, use a large Lianqiao powder to dispel it; if it’s a surface heat symptom, use Chaihu powder. There is also Fengyuan powder to cover it.

    According to the theory, if a child’s stomach energy is balanced, the brain marrow will be full and the top of the head will gradually flatten. If the stomach is heated, it steams the internal organs, causing thirst and leading to diarrhea, which blocks heat in the organs. This weakens the blood and energy, hence the top of the head sinks. The "Sheng Ji Jing" recommends using Danggui powder and Dihuang pills for treatment.[12p]

    　　　　　目内证

    　　目内赤者心热，导赤散主之。淡红者心虚热，生犀散主之。青，肝热，泻青丸主之。浅淡者补之。黄者脾热，泻黄散主之。无精光者肾虚，地黄丸主之。《龙木论》以小儿斗睛候，皆因失误筑打，损着头面额角，兼倒仆，令儿肝受惊风，遂使两眼斗晴，宜服牛黄丸。口议血眼，宜服生熟地黄散，流行血气。热毒服小防风汤，风毒服小流气饮，积毒服小菊花膏主之。斑疮入眼，决明散、密蒙花散主之。又有犀角散、石楠散，通顶为妙。或吐泻后眼如上膜，或痘疹入眼，恨不能开，及诸证眼定无精光，难治。[13p]

    Eye Conditions and Treatments

    If the eyes are red, it indicates heat in the heart; treat with "Da Chi San". If they are light red, it suggests deficiency heat in the heart; use "Sheng Xi San". If the eyes appear green, it indicates liver heat; treat with "Xie Qing Wan". If the color is pale, it should be replenished. If yellow, it suggests spleen heat; use "Xie Huang San". If there is no luster in the eyes, it indicates kidney deficiency; treat with "Di Huang Wan". According to the "Long Mu Lun", when young children have crossed eyes, it is often due to accidents causing injury to the head, resulting in shock to the liver, leading to the condition. For this, "Niu Huang Wan" is recommended. For bloodshot eyes, take "Sheng Shu Di Huang San", as it promotes blood circulation. For heat toxins, use "Xiao Fang Feng Tang"; for wind toxins, use "Xiao Liu Qi Yin"; and for accumulated toxins, "Xiao Ju Hua Gao" is appropriate. If there are rashes affecting the eyes, "Jue Ming San" or "Mi Meng Hua San" is recommended. Additionally, "Xi Jiao San" or "Shi Nan San" can also be effective. Sometimes after vomiting or diarrhea, the eyes may appear covered, or if there are rashes affecting the eyes, causing distress, if there are various symptoms leading to a loss of luster in the eyes, it can be difficult to treat.[13p]

    　　　　　耳病

    　　耳者肾之候。小儿肾经气实，其热气上冲于耳，遂使津液壅滞为脓为汁者也。亦有澡浴水入耳中，水湿停留，搏于血气，酝酿成热，亦令耳脓。久而不瘥，变而聋耳。龙骨散主之。又汤氏有五般聤耳候。聤耳者，常有黄脓出是也；脓耳者，常有红脓出是也；缠耳者，常有白脓出是也；底耳者，里面腥臭；囊耳者，里面虚鸣，时出清脓。然五般病源一也，皆由风水入耳，内有积热上壅而成。若不早治，久则成聋。胭脂膏等治之，仍服化痰退热等剂即愈。[14p]

    Ear Disease

    The ear is a manifestation of the kidney. In children, when the kidney energy is abundant, the heat rises and impacts the ear, causing fluids to stagnate and transform into pus or other substances. Additionally, when water from bathing enters the ear, the humidity stays and interacts with the blood energy, brewing heat, which can also cause ear pus. If it persists without healing, it may eventually lead to deafness. Long Gu San is indicated for this condition.

    Moreover, the Tang family has identified five types of ear discharge. The first type, "yellow pus ear," usually has yellow pus discharging; the second type, "red pus ear," typically has red pus; the third type, "white pus ear," consistently has white pus; the fourth type, "foul ear," has a stinky discharge from within; and the fifth type, "hollow ear," presents with a hollow, ringing sound and sometimes discharges clear pus. However, all five conditions stem from the same source: wind and water entering the ear, leading to internal accumulation of heat. If not treated promptly, it may result in deafness. Treatments such as Yan Zhi Gao and others, along with medications to resolve phlegm and reduce heat, can result in recovery.[14p]

    　　　　　鼻病

    　　凡牙儿三朝、五日、六晨、一腊，忽然鼻塞，吻乳不能，开口呼吸者，多是乳母安睡之时，鼻中出息，吹着儿顖；或以水浴洗，用水温冷，不避风邪，所以致儿鼻塞。宜与通关膏傅之，消风散服之。或有惊悸作热，薄荷散与服，生者亦佳。　　又有鼻衄，是热搏于气而乘于血也。肺主一身之皮毛，口气开窍于鼻，蕴寒先客皮肤，搏于气而成热，热乘于血，血得热而妄行，从鼻中出者，名鼻衄也。或未及发汗而鼻燥喘息，鼻气鸣即衄。治法皆依大方而分剂略轻耳。黄芩汤、犀角地黄汤主之，生地黄、茅根煎服，尤佳。　　鼻衄者，黄芩汤主之。清肺饮子治(上匿下虫)鼻，凉膈。[15p]

    Nasal Illness

    For infants, on the third day, fifth day, sixth morning, or in the middle of a month, if they suddenly have nasal congestion and cannot suckle or breathe through the mouth, this often occurs when the wet nurse is asleep, and the exhalation from her nose blows onto the child. Alternatively, washing with water, whether warm or cold, without avoiding wind and cold can cause nasal congestion in the child. It is advisable to apply a nasal opening ointment and use dispersing medicine. If there are signs of fright and heat, peppermint powder can be taken, which is also good for the living.

    There is also nosebleed, which occurs when heat attacks the qi and affects the blood. The lungs control the skin and hair of the entire body, and the mouth opens the cavities to the nose. If cold first enters the skin and then attacks the qi forming heat, this heat then affects the blood. When the blood becomes heated and behaves erratically, it releases from the nose, which is called a nosebleed. If sweating does not occur and dryness and wheezing in the nose persist, it can lead to a nosebleed. Treatment methods follow traditional formulas and adjust dosages slightly. Huangqin Decoction and Rhinoceros Horn and Rehmannia Decoction are the main treatments. Boiled fresh Rehmannia and reed roots are especially effective. For nosebleeds, Huangqin Decoction is the main treatment. Qingfei Drink treats the nose (covering inner pests) and cools the diaphragm.[15p]

    　　　　保婴撮要 【明　薛铠】

    　　　　　解颅顖填顖陷

    　　夫肾主骨，肾气实则脑髓充而顖早合，骨脉盛而齿早生；肾气怯则脑髓虚而顖不合。此由父母精血不足，宜地黄丸补之。若在乳下，当兼补其母，调补脾肾为善。亦因所禀肾气不足，及乳哺失宜，脾胃亏损所致，并用补中益气汤。亦有泻痢气血虚，脾胃不能上充者，亦用前法。若手足并冷，前汤加姜桂；未应，虚寒甚也，急加附子。缓则多致不救。[16p]

    Essentials of Infant Care

    The kidneys govern the bones. When kidney energy is sufficient, the brain's marrow fills, and the fontanel closes early; the bones and vessels flourish, and teeth emerge early. When kidney energy is weak, the brain's marrow is deficient, and the fontanel does not close. This occurs due to insufficient essence and blood from the parents, and it is advisable to use Rehmannia Pills for supplementation. If the child is still nursing, the mother should also supplement to harmonize and nourish the spleen and kidneys. Additionally, this condition may arise from inherent weakness in kidney energy and improper nursing, leading to deficiency in the spleen and stomach, which would also require the use of the Qi-Increasing Decoction. In cases of diarrhea with weak qi and blood, where the spleen and stomach cannot provide nourishment, the same approach applies. If the hands and feet are cold, add ginger and cinnamon to the previous decoction; if there is no response, indicating severe cold deficiency, urgently add Aconite. Delays may lead to irreparable consequences.[16p]

    　　　　　耳证

    　　耳者，心肾之窍，肝胆之经也。心肾主内证精血不足，肝胆主外证风热有余。或聋聩或虚鸣者，禀赋虚也；或胀痛或脓痒者，邪气客也。禀赋不足，宜用六味地黄丸。肝经风热，宜用柴胡清肝散。若因血燥，用栀子清肝散；未应，佐以六味丸，间服九味芦荟丸。若因肾肝疳热，朝用六味丸，夕用芦荟丸。若因食积内热，用四味肥儿丸。若因乳母膏粱积热而致者，宜加味清胃散。脾经郁结而致者，加味归脾汤。肝经怒火而致者，宜加味逍遥散。皆令乳母服之，兼与其儿少许。不可专于治外，不惟闭塞耳窍，抑亦变生他证，延留日久，遂成终身之聩矣。慎之！[17p]

    Ear Disorders

    The ear is the aperture of the heart and kidneys, and it corresponds to the liver and gallbladder. The heart and kidneys govern internal Essence and blood deficiency, while the liver and gallbladder are associated with external conditions of excess wind and heat. Conditions such as deafness or tinnitus are due to congenital deficiency; whereas symptoms like fullness, pain, or itch with pus are caused by pathogenic factors. For congenital insufficiency, one should use Liu Wei Di Huang Wan. For excess wind-heat in the liver channel, Cha Hu Qing Gan San is recommended. If due to blood dryness, Zhi Zi Qing Gan San should be used; if ineffective, it can be supplemented with Liu Wei Wan and intermittently combined with Jiu Wei Lu Huo Wan. If caused by kidney and liver heat, Liu Wei Wan should be taken in the morning, and Lu Huo Wan in the evening. For food accumulation leading to internal heat, Si Wei Fei Er Wan is indicated. If it is caused by excess heat from food consumed by a nursing mother, Jia Wei Qing Wei San should be added. If due to spleen stagnation, add Jia Wei Gui Pi Tang. If anger heat in the liver channel is the cause, Jia Wei Xiao Yao San is appropriate. All the above should be taken by the nursing mother, with a small amount given to the child. One should not focus solely on treating the external symptoms, as this can also block the ear channel, leading to other disorders, prolonged retention leading to lifelong deafness. Be cautious![17p]

    　　　　　目内证

    　　经曰：目者五脏六腑之精，荣卫魂魄之所常营也，神气之所常主也。又曰：诸脉者皆属于目，目得血而能视。五脏六腑精气，皆上注于目而为之精。故白睛属肺，黑睛属肝，瞳人属肾，上下胞属脾，两眦属心，而内眦又属膀胱。五脏五色，各有所司。心主赤，赤甚心实热也，用导赤散；赤微者，心虚热也，用生犀角散。肝主青，青甚者肝热也，用泻青丸；淡青者，肝虚也，用地黄丸。脾主黄，黄甚者脾热也，用泻黄散；淡黄者，脾虚也，用异功散。目无精光，及白睛多黑晴少者，肝肾俱不足也，用地黄丸加鹿茸。昼视通明，夜视罔见者，因禀阳气衰弱，遇夜阴盛则阳愈衰，故不能视也，用冲和养胃汤。凡赤脉翳物从上而下者，属足太阳经，用东垣选奇汤；从下而上者，属足阳明经，用局方流气饮。盖翳膜者，风热内蕴也。邪气未定，谓之热翳而浮于外，邪气已定谓之水翳而沉于内，邪气既深，谓之陷翳。宜升发之，退翳之药佐之。[18p]

    Vision Diagnosis

    The scripture states: The eyes are the essence of the five organs and six bowels, constantly nourished by the spirit and soul. They are the main control of the spirit and qi. It is also said that all channels are connected to the eyes; the eyes obtain blood to see. The essence and qi from the five organs and six bowels flow upward to nourish the eyes. Therefore, the white part of the eye corresponds to the lungs, the black part to the liver, the pupil to the kidneys, the upper and lower eyelids to the spleen, the inner canthus to the heart, and the outer canthus to the bladder. Each of the five organs corresponds to a color, each having its own functions. The heart governs red; if red is excessive, it indicates heart fire, treated with a dispersing formula for red. If red is slight, it indicates heart deficiency heat, treated with a nourishing formula containing rhinoceros horn. The liver governs green; if green is excessive, it indicates liver heat, treated with a cooling formula for green. If it is pale green, it indicates liver deficiency, treated with a formula of Rehmannia. The spleen governs yellow; if yellow is excessive, it indicates spleen heat, treated with a cooling formula for yellow. If it is pale yellow, it indicates spleen deficiency, treated with a replenishing formula. If the eyes lack brightness and the white part is dark with little clarity, it indicates deficiency of both liver and kidneys, treated with a formula of Rehmannia combined with deer antler. If vision is clear by day but lost by night, it results from weakened yang qi, and in the presence of strong yin at night, the yang weakens further, resulting in inability to see, treated with a harmonizing and stomach nourishing decoction. If there are red channels with opacities moving from top to bottom, it belongs to the Foot Taiyang channel, treated with Dongyuan's selected extraordinary decoction; if moving from bottom to top, it belongs to the Foot Yangming channel, treated with a formula for regulating qi. The opacity membranes indicate internal wind-heat. If the pathogenic qi is unsettled, it is called hot opacity and floats on the surface; if the pathogenic qi is settled, it is called water opacity and sinks within; if the pathogenic qi is deep, it is called trapped opacity. It is advisable to use medicines that uplift and dispel the opacity.[18p]

    若上眼皮下出黑白翳者，属太阳寒水；从外至内者，属少阳风热；从下至上绿色者，属足阳明及肺肾合病也。疳眼者，因肝火湿热上冲，脾气有亏，不能上升清气，故生白翳，睫闭不开，眵泪如糊，久而脓流，遂至损目，用益气聪明汤、茯苓泻湿汤及四味肥儿丸。目闭不开者，因乳食失节，或过服寒凉之药，使阳气下陷，不能升举，故目不开，用柴胡复生汤。若胃气亏损，眼睫无力而不能开者，用补中益气汤。暴赤肿痛者，肝火炽盛也，用龙胆泻肝汤。[19p]

    If there are black and white spots appearing under the upper eyelid, it relates to cold water of the sun; if they progress from the outside inwards, it pertains to the wind and heat of the lesser yang; if they appear green from the bottom upwards, it is related to the foot yangming and diseases of the lungs and kidneys. For cataracts, this is caused by the upward surge of liver fire and damp heat, with deficiency in the spleen failing to raise clear qi, leading to white spots, inability to open the eyelids, and tears that resemble paste, which over time can produce pus and damage the eyes. One should use the Remedies to Enhance Qi and Brighten Vision, the Poria Decoction to Drain Dampness, and the Four Flavor Fattening Pills. If the eyes cannot open, it may be due to irregular intake of dairy and food, or excessive consumption of cold medicines, causing the yang qi to sink and failing to rise, hence the inability to open the eyes; this requires the Bupleurum Decoction to Restore Life. If there is deficiency in stomach qi, and the eyelashes lack strength, causing an inability to open, one should use the Decoction to Tonify the Middle and Augment Qi. If there is sudden redness, swelling, and pain, this indicates an exuberance of liver fire; the Longdancao Decoction to Drain the Liver should be employed.[19p]

    多泪羞明者，肝心积热也，用生犀散。亦有肝肾虚热者，用地黄丸。风弦烂眼者，膈有积热也，用清胃散。时时作痒者，脓溃生虫也，用点药紫苏膏。眼睫连札者，肝经风热也，用柴胡清肝散。若生下目黄壮热，大小便秘结，乳食不思，面赤眼闭者，皆由在胎时感母热毒所致，儿服泻黄散，母服地黄丸。若乳母膏梁积热，致儿目黄者，令母服清胃散。若肢体面目爪甲皆黄，小便如屋尘色者，难治。又有痘疹后余毒未尽，上侵于目者，属肾肝虚也，用滋阴肾气丸。前证宜审治其母，兼调其儿。[20p]

    For those who have watery eyes and feel shy in the light, it is due to accumulated heat in the liver and heart; use Shengxi San. There are also cases of liver and kidney deficiency heat; for these, use Dihuang Wan. If the eyes are afflicted by wind and feel rotten, it is due to accumulated heat in the diaphragm; use Qingwei San. If there is frequent itching, it indicates the presence of pus and maggots; apply Zisu Gao. If the eyelashes are entangled, it is due to wind-heat in the liver channel; use Chaihu Qinggan San. If there is yellowing of the lower eyes accompanied by strong fever, constipation, lack of appetite, flushed face, and closed eyes, this is caused by the mother’s heat and toxins during pregnancy; the child should take Xiehuang San and the mother Dihuang Wan. If the breastfeeding mother has accumulated heat causing the child’s yellowing eyes, the mother should take Qingwei San. If the limbs, face, and nails are all yellow, and the urine is the color of house dust, it is difficult to treat. Additionally, if there are residual toxins from measles affecting the eyes, it indicates kidney and liver deficiency; use Ziyin Shenqi Wan. For the aforementioned conditions, it is advisable to carefully treat the mother while also adjusting the child’s treatment.[20p]

    　　　　　鼻塞鼻衄

    　　巢氏云：鼻乃肺之窍，皮毛腠理乃肺之主。此因风邪客于肺，而鼻塞不利者，宜用消风散，或用葱白七茎，入油腻粉少许，擂摊绢帛上，掌中护温，贴顖门。因惊仆气散，血无所羁而鼻衄者，用异功散加柴胡、山栀子。左脸青而兼赤者，先用柴胡清肝散，后用地黄丸；右脸赤，乃肺大肠实热也，用泻白散。鼻色赤乃脾胃实热也，用泻黄散；微赤乃脾经虚热也，用异功散加升麻、柴胡；色深黄，用济生犀用地黄汤，后用杨氏地黄丸；淡白色用六君子汤。颏间色赤，用四物汤加山栀；赤甚用五麻散；小便赤色，用六味丸、补中益气汤。唇色白，用六君子汤；久不愈，用麦门冬饮子。若初病元气未亏，乳食如常，发热壮热，二便秘结，作渴饮水，卧不露睛者，悉属形病俱实，当治邪气。若病久元气已亏，食少发热，口干饮汤，呕吐泄泻，肢体畏寒，卧而露睛者，悉属形病俱虚，当补正气为要。[21p]

    Nasal Congestion and Nosebleed

    The Physician Chao stated: The nose is the opening of the lungs, and the skin and pores are primarily linked to the lungs. When wind pathogens invade the lungs, causing nasal congestion and obstruction, one should use Xiaofeng San (Wind-dispelling Powder) or take seven green onion stalks, mix them with a small amount of oily powder, pound them, and then apply to the Yinzhen (the area between the eyebrows) while keeping it warm in the palm. If there is a nosebleed due to panic causing the qi to scatter and the blood to lose its restraint, one should use Yigong San (Special Efficacy Powder) combined with Chaihu (Bupleurum) and Shan Zhi Zi (Gardenia fruit). If the left side of the face is both blue and red, one should first use Chaihu Qinggan San (Bupleurum Liver-clearing Powder) and then take Dihuang Wan (Rehmannia Pill). If the right side of the face is red, it indicates heat in the lungs and large intestine, so one should use Xiebai San (White-draining Powder). If the nose is red, it indicates excess heat in the spleen and stomach, which requires Xiehuang San (Yellow-draining Powder). If slightly red, it indicates deficiency heat in the spleen channel, necessitating Yigong San with additional Shengma (Cimicifuga) and Chaihu. If the color is deep yellow, use Jisheng Xiang Di Huang Tang (Life-sustaining Rehmannia Decoction) followed by Yang's Dihuang Wan. If pale white, use Liu Junzi Tang (Six Gentlemen Decoction). If there is redness between the chin, use Siwu Tang (Four Substance Decoction) with Shan Zhi Zi; if severe redness, apply Wuma San (Five-Sesame Powder). If the urine is reddish, use Liuwei Wan (Six-Flavor Pill) or Buzhong Yiqi Tang (Tonifying the Middle and Benefiting Qi Decoction). If the lips are white, use Liu Junzi Tang; if it hasn’t healed for a long time, use Maimendong Yin (Ophiopogon Decoction).

    If the illness is recent and the original qi is not depleted, with normal intake of food, fever, strong heat, constipation, thirst for water, and sleeping with open eyes, this indicates that both the form and sickness are solid and treatment should focus on expelling the pathogen. If the illness has lasted a long time and the original qi is depleted, with reduced appetite, fever, dry mouth, drinking soup, vomiting, diarrhea, cold sensitivity in the limbs, and sleeping with open eyes, this indicates that both the form and sickness are deficient and the main focus should be on replenishing the righteous qi.[21p]

    　　　　古今医统 【明　徐春甫】

    　　　　　颅顖论

    　　《颅顖经》曰：顖门未合，筋骨柔弱。顖门青筋，脉虚不荣。顖门常坑，滑泄便便。顖门突起，风疾不止。顖门久冷，吐利清清。顖门虚软，颠癎不免。顖门扁阙，暴泄易脱。顖门喎长，风作必亡。顖门连额，惊癎易得。顖门未完，怕热怯寒。顖门缓收，胎气不周。顖门动数，神昏气弱。顖门宽大，多疾受害。颅顖者，精神之门户也，关窍之囊钥也。上下相贯，百会相通。七窍应透，五脏所借。泥丸之宫，魂魄之穴。气实则合，气虚则开。良由长大，不可不合。医师见之，当知可否。用药消息之。顖门宽大，受病深重，恐药难疗，不可不慎也。[22p]

    Discussion on the Fontanel

    The "Sutra on the Fontanel" states: If the fontanel has not closed, the sinews and bones will be soft and weak. If the fontanel shows blue veins, it signifies a weak and un-nourished pulse. If the fontanel is constantly sunken, it leads to frequent diarrhea. If the fontanel is protruding, wind diseases will not cease. If the fontanel remains cold for a long time, it causes clear vomiting and diarrhea. If the fontanel is soft and slack, seizures from dizziness are unavoidable. If the fontanel is flat and depressed, diarrhea may easily occur. If the fontanel is elongated, it predisposes to death from wind. If the fontanel connects with the forehead, it is easy to be startled into convulsions. If the fontanel is incomplete, there will be fear of heat and aversion to cold. If the fontanel closes slowly, the prenatal energy may be inadequate. If the fontanel has frequent movements, it indicates confusion of the spirit and weakness of energy. If the fontanel is wide, it leads to numerous illnesses and suffering. The fontanel is the gateway of the spirit and the key to the pathways of the body. It connects the upper and lower regions and links all important points. The seven orifices should be open, as are those of the five organs. The palace of the mud ball is the cavity of the soul and spirit. When energy is strong, it is closed; when energy is weak, it is open. This is due to growth; closure cannot be neglected. Physicians, upon examination, should discern the situation and decide on treatment. Medications must be employed cautiously. If the fontanel is wide and the illness is severe, the fear is that treatment may be difficult, necessitating caution.[22p]

    　　　　证治准绳 【明　王肯堂】

    　　　　　解颅

    　　父精不足，则解颅，眼白多。
    　　解颅者，人之无脑髓，如木无根。古人虽有良方，劳而无功也。亦不可束手待毙，宜依钱氏补肾，万一有可生之理。钱氏补肾地黄丸加鹿茸之类是也。　　曾氏云：凡得此候，不及千日之内，间有数岁者。偶因他疾攻激，遂成废人。若气色清明，能饮食者，多服调元散、补肾地黄丸，旬日内颇见效者。次第调理，或有可治。若投药后如故，亦难疗矣。　　田氏云：解颅治法，宜用生地散。

    　　　　　顖陷

    　　曾氏云：顖陷者，虚之极也。胃气虚寒则顖陷，慢惊中有之。胃寒脾困吐泻者为虚极，急以金液丹、固真汤及诸救元等药治之，外则贴以乌附膏。　　有后枕陷者，其证尤重。治法与顖陷药同。不效，亦为难疗。此大虚极，百无一活耳。[23p]

    Diagnosis and Treatment Principles [Ming Dynasty, Wang Kentang]

    Case of Scalp Deformity

    When paternal essence is insufficient, there will be a deformity of the scalp, and the whites of the eyes will be prominent. A scalp deformity suggests the absence of brain marrow, like a tree without roots. Though the ancients had good remedies, they would prove ineffective after much effort. However, one should not wait idly; it is advisable to rely on the Qian family's kidney-tonifying methods, in case there is any principle by which life can be sustained. The Qian family's Ginseng and Rehmannia Pill combined with deer antler is an example. Zeng says: Those who exhibit these signs, within a thousand days, may sometimes endure for a few years. An illness could suddenly worsen, resulting in severe disability. If the complexion is clear and the person can consume food, taking items like the Regulating Yuan Powder or Reinforcing Kidney Rehmannia Pills will show significant effects within ten days. Adjusting the treatment gradually may yield a cure. If treatment yields no change, healing will be difficult.

    Tian states: For scalp deformity treatment, it is advisable to use Fresh Rehmannia Powder.

    Case of Sunken Fontanel

    Zeng states: A sunken fontanel represents extreme deficiency. When the stomach's energy is deficient and cold, it leads to this condition, which may be associated with chronic fright. If one experiences stomach cold combined with spleen burden, leading to vomiting and diarrhea, this indicates extreme deficiency. One should promptly utilize Golden Elixir Pill, Gu Zhen Decoction, and other reviving medicines, externally applying black adhesive plaster. For those with sinking at the back of the head, the symptoms are particularly severe. The treatment methods are the same as those for a sunken fontanel. If there is no effectiveness, healing will be difficult. This indicates extreme deficiency, with almost no possibility of survival.[23p]

    　　　　　顖填

    　　顖填之证，亦有因小儿胁下有积，咳且啼而气上逆，啼甚久其气未定，因而乳之者；肝气盛，风热上冲者，皆能令顖填，当一一审其因而治之。寒者温之，热者凉之。气上逆者，和而降之；肝气盛者，泻青为主。热证里多大连翘汤，表多柴胡散，虚者以补中益气汤送下地黄丸。神而明之，存乎其人，言不尽意。　　曾氏云：世言顖肿皆以为热，殊不知有阴阳二证，切宜详辨。坚硬为阴，红软为阳，故《婴孩宝书》云：寒气上冲则牢(革卬)，热气上冲则柔软。正此之谓。若阴证，以匀气散、理中汤主之；阳证用玉露饮、当归散、防风汤为治。　　《石壁经》歌曰：积聚脾中热不通，致令面赤口唇红。胸高夜嗽多填胀，休使流传肺有风。[24p]

    Translation:

    Herniation

    The evidence of herniation can arise from an accumulation under the child's ribs, causing cough and crying, with the breath rising in reverse; if the crying persists for a long time and the breath has not settled, it is due to nursing; conditions of excess liver qi and ascent of wind-heat can also cause herniation. One must investigate each cause and treat accordingly. For those with cold, warm them; for those with heat, cool them. For reversed breath, harmonize and bring it down; for excess liver qi, use draining techniques primarily. In cases of heat, the formula Da Lian Qiao Tang is often used, while for exterior conditions, Xiao Feng San is recommended; for deficient cases, use Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang followed by Di Huang Wan. One must understand and clarify, as it resides within each person, and words cannot fully express intent.

    The Zeng family states: people in the world often think of swelling as solely a heat issue, but little do they know, there are both yin and yang conditions that should be carefully distinguished. Hardness signifies yin while redness and softness signify yang, hence the "Children's Treasure Book" states: if cold qi ascends, it becomes firm; if heat qi ascends, it becomes soft. This is precisely what is meant. For yin conditions, manage with Yun Qi San or Li Zhong Tang; for yang conditions, use Yu Lu Yin, Dang Gui San, or Fang Feng Tang for treatment.

    The "Shi Bi Jing" verse states: "Accumulated heat in the spleen not flowing leads to a red face and lips. Chest tightness and nighttime coughing bring about filling and swelling; do not allow it to spread, provoking wind in the lungs."[24p]

    喉里作声涎上壅，顖门肿起热来冲。但教凉膈安灵腑，能使三朝速有功。　　积有冷热，皆能作肿。冷则粪白，或酸臭气冲人，亦有虫出，其食物皆不能化，腹胀满而多困，喉中亦鸣也。热则使多渴，其粪赤，面色亦黄赤，口内臭气，亦虫出。各看其证候调治，且须分水谷去积并调气。冷则温脾胃，热则去其热，化涎止渴。顖陷则冷也，肿则热也。积热顖虚肿。宜将时气门中三十六种除湿散，浓煎桑白皮汤下。　　《形证论》云：肺热生风涎鸣顖肿，将白丁香膏一二服，或南星丸一二服便退。　　《秘要指迷论方》：凡小儿生下一月日内，或顖门肿，此乃受胎热气，即用黄蘗膏涂于足心涌泉穴，如陷即用半夏膏涂手心。此乃婴儿肾受冷气，邪干心，致令病生。黄蘗、半夏皆为末，皆冷水调贴。[25p]

    When sounds are made in the throat and phlegm accumulates, the fontanel swells and heat rises. If only the cooling of the diaphragm can soothe the spirit, it will lead to quick results. Both heat and cold can cause swelling. Cold leads to white stools or a sour, foul smell that assaults the senses, sometimes with worms emerging, as food cannot be digested, resulting in abdominal bloating and discomfort, with rumbling in the throat. Heat causes excessive thirst, results in red stools, presents with a yellowish complexion, bad breath, and also leads to worms emerging. Each condition should be treated according to its symptoms, while also requiring the removal of accumulated food and the regulation of qi. Cold indicates the need to warm the spleen and stomach, while heat needs to be dealt with to transform phlegm and stop thirst. When the fontanel is sunken, it indicates cold; when swollen, it indicates heat. Accumulated heat and a poorly-formed sunken fontanel suggest that the thirty-six types of damp-clearing powder should be used, along with a concentrated decoction of mulberry bark.

    The "Theory of Physical Symptoms" states: Lung heat causes wind-phlegm and fontanel swelling; administering a dose of white cloves syrup or a few doses of nandina pills will alleviate the condition.

    The "Essential Guide to Strategies" suggests: Whenever infants show swelling in the fontanel within the first month after birth, this is due to the heat energy received during gestation. Apply Huangbo ointment to the Yongquan acupoint on the soles of their feet. If it is sunken, use Banxia ointment on the palms. This indicates that the infant's kidneys are affected by cold qi, disrupting the heart and resulting in illness. Both Huangbo and Banxia are in powdered form, to be mixed with cold water for application.[25p]

    　　　　　天柱倒

    　　王先生云：小儿久患疳疾体虚，久不进饮食，患来日久，诸候退，只是天柱骨倒。医者不识，谓之五软候。须进金灵散、生筋散。　　《形证论》歌：天柱才倒道难医，算来此病非心脾。若患先须因吐泻，不曾调气至尩羸。大患伤寒无汗脉，　　《凤髓经》此一句云：却被伤寒无浮脉。　　定应妙药疗他迟。无此卒然生此患，又兼不辨四肢肥。身软难堪头似石，面红唇赤脸如绯。此病多因伤肾热，后来因热病相随。此两句在《凤髓经》即云：此患只应伤胆热，后来伏热又相随。　　肝受热风天柱倒，但将凉药与维持。贴须性热筋方缓，立见温和请勿疑。吐泻项软惟调气，伤寒柱倒不须医。　　此或伤寒，或吐或泻，邪毒乘虚透入肝脉，热邪所侵，是以致令筋软长，或手足软而不解举，或项颈软而不解举。若有前证，即须凉膈；若吐泻则先调胃气，贴项，并服凉肝胆药。不可太热，亦恐过寒。[26p]

    The Inversion of the Celestial Pillar

    Mr. Wang states: The child has long suffered from malnutrition, being weak in body and not consuming food and drink for an extended period. As the condition worsens, the symptoms recede, leading to the inversion of the celestial pillar bone. The physicians do not recognize this and label it as the five soft conditions. One must administer Jinling San and Shengjin San.

    Song from "Treatise on Symptoms": The celestial pillar being inverted is difficult to treat, as this illness is neither of the heart nor the spleen. If one is afflicted, one must first consider vomiting or diarrhea; otherwise, the vital energy becomes depleted. Significant concerns arise with cold damage and the absence of a pulse; as mentioned in the "Feng Sui Jing": one is then affected by cold damage with no floating pulse.

    Appropriate medicine must be used to treat this condition; without a sudden onset of this ailment, one also cannot discern the nuances of the limbs being robust. If the body feels weak and the head is heavy, the face is flushed, lips reddened, the disease often arises from kidney heat, which later leads to residual heat illnesses.

    The two verses in the "Feng Sui Jing" say: This ailment should only arise from gallbladder heat, and later latent heat will follow. The liver endures the heat and wind as the celestial pillar inverts, hence cool herbs must be administered to stabilize the condition.

    It is essential to use warm medicinal herbs to alleviate it; immediate relief will be seen, so do not doubt. With vomiting or diarrhea, one must only regulate the vital energy; in cases of cold damage with the pillar inversion, no medical treatment is necessary.

    This may relate to cold damage or be due to vomiting or diarrhea; the evil toxins penetrate the liver's channel, and the hot evil invades, resulting in weakened sinews. This may cause hands and feet to soften and remain unraised, or the neck and shoulders to weaken, impeding movement. If previous symptoms are present, one must cool the diaphragm; if vomiting or diarrhea occurs, first regulate the stomach's energy, apply cool medicines for the liver and gallbladder. One must not use excessively hot treatments, as one may also fear excessive cold.[26p]

    　　　　　头疮论

    　　小儿头疮，是六阳受毒热而攻头成疮也。若头上散成片，常常燥痒，毛发稀少，有类白屑，此因积热上攻，名曰秃疮。疮虽生于头，世人只知以药外敷得愈，不逾旬月，其疮又发。何为而然？盖头者诸阳所会之处。《洪范》五行：火曰炎上。热毒上攻，两阳相灼，故疮生于头。法当解陈莝之积热，导心经之烦躁斯可矣。　　小儿久癞头，以防风通圣散酒制，除大黄另研为末，再用酒拌晒干为末，每用一钱，水煎服。日四五服，至三十贴见效。[27p]

    Discussion on Scalp Sores

    Scalp sores in children are caused by the six yang energies being afflicted by toxins and heat, leading to sores on the head. If sores spread in patches on the scalp, often accompanied by dryness, itchiness, and sparse hair resembling white flakes, this is due to accumulated heat attacking upwards, known as "bald sores." Although the sores appear on the head, people generally only know to apply external medicine for treatment, and even if cured within ten days or a month, the sores often recur. Why is that? It is because the head is the convergence point for all yang energies. According to the "Hong Fan" in the Five Elements theory, fire is said to rise up. Heat and toxins attacking upwards and the two yang energies scorching each other result in sores on the head. The treatment should focus on alleviating the accumulated heat and calming the heart's agitation. For chronic scalp sores in children, a remedy using the Feng Tong Sheng San mixed with wine can be employed, along with separately ground Da Huang to a fine powder. This should then be mixed with wine and dried to become a powder. Each dose should be one qian, boiled in water for consumption, taken four to five times a day. Improvement can be seen after around thirty applications.[27p]

    　　　　　发迟发黄

    　　巢氏云：足少阴为肾之经、其华在发。小儿有禀性少阴之血气不足，即发疏薄不生，亦有因头疮而脱落不生者，皆由伤损其血，血气损少不能荣于发也。足少阴肾经，其血气华于发，血气不足则不能润悦于发，故发黄也。
    　　　　　目赤肿痛

    　　曾氏云：热极挟风，则目赤肿痛，昼夜不开，惊啼不已。先用九仙散，水姜葱煎服；次三解散，温米泔水调下，及点以黄连膏。　　若夫天行时证，暴赤肿痛，昼夜苦甚，久则昏蒙。治法先以九仙散解表；次以小柴胡汤去半夏，加大黄、薄荷、竹叶、生地黄，水煎服；并投草龙胆散，及点以黄连膏，贴以清凉膏。　　有孩儿胃气素虚，脾气实盛，眼泡赤肿，羞濇不开，遽按苦寒之剂以退赤肿，反伤脾胃，不吐则泻，或四肢微寒；复以温药调治，则目疾转加。[28p]

    Hair being Late and Yellow

    The Chao clan said: The Foot Shaoyin is the channel of the kidney, and its manifestation is in the hair. If a child is born with insufficient Shaoyin blood and qi, their hair will be sparse, thin, and fail to grow. There are also cases where hair falls out due to scalp sores. This all arises from damage to the blood; when blood and qi are deficient, they cannot nourish the hair, leading to its yellowing.

    Red, Swollen, and Painful Eyes

    The Zeng clan said: Extreme heat combined with wind leads to red, swollen, and painful eyes, which stay shut day and night, causing constant crying without cessation. First, use the Jiu Xian powder, decocted with water, ginger, and scallions, for internal consumption; then use the San Jie powder mixed with warm rice wash for oral administration, and apply Huanglian ointment.

    If there are symptoms caused by seasonal variations, with sudden redness and swelling of the eyes, and severe pain ongoing day and night, leading to confusion if prolonged: First, use Jiu Xian powder to resolve the exterior; then use Xiao Chai Hu Decoction minus Ban Xia, with the addition of Da Huang, Bohe, Zhu Ye, and Sheng Di Huang, decocted for consumption; also administer Cao Long Dan powder and apply Huanglian ointment, along with cooling plasters.

    For children with a naturally weak stomach and strong spleen qi, presenting with red, swollen eyelids and an inability to open their eyes, using harsh cold medications to reduce redness and swelling can harm the spleen and stomach, causing vomiting if not diarrhea, or slightly cold extremities. Furthermore, if warm medications are used to treat them, the eye condition may worsen.[28p]

    宜先用(口父)咀五苓散，水姜灯心煎服，次投泻黄散自愈。　　有心脾蕴热经久，及肝受邪热，致两目羞明，眼泡浮肿，微有紫色，大腑闭或流利，小便濇或通顺。先以百解散发表，次投明目饮，自然平复。仍忌酒荤三五日。　　有小儿薄劣，多致尘埃入目，揩摩成肿，发热作痛，啼哭不已。用辟尘膏治之，立效。　　余平生无眼赤之患，用之如神，大人小儿可通用。凡眼赤濇之初，只用自己小便，张目溺出用一指按抹眼中，便闭目少顷，即效。此以真气逼去邪热也。[29p]

    First, use (Koufu) Five Ling Powder, steeped in water with ginger and lantern heart, and take it. After that, administer Purgative Yellow Powder for self-recovery.

    For long-standing heart and spleen heat accumulation, and liver receiving heat evil, leading to shy brightness of the eyes, swollen eyelids with slight purpleness, large intestine obstruction or diarrhea, and either turbid or smooth urination—first use Baijie Powder to disperse, then administer Bright Eye Decoction for natural recovery. Also, avoid alcohol and meat for three to five days.

    For children who are weak and often have dust entering their eyes, causing swelling, heat, pain, and persistent crying—apply Dust-Repelling Ointment for immediate effect.

    In my life, I have never had issues of red eyes, and I have used this remedy successfully. It can be used for both adults and children. For initial cases of red and watery eyes, simply use your own urine, open your eyes to let it flow out while pressing with a finger on the eyes, then close your eyes for a moment, and it will be effective. This works by using true energy to expel the evil heat.[29p]

    　　　　　外障

    　　小儿病目生翳，不可轻用点药，只以服药内消为主。看赤脉上下内外，分经处治。
    　　　　　痘疮入目

    　　痘疮之毒，发于五脏六腑，毒之盛者，眼必受之。古人留护眼之法，其意深矣。凡疮出太甚，两眼常出泪者，肝热也。此时眼中无疮，但内服泻肝火之药。盖眼中之痘，常在收靥不齐之后有之。如疮入目成肤翳者，切不可用点眼药，损睛破瞳，成废人矣。痘疹收后，目不可开者，肝热则目濇不敢开，明暗皆然；心热见明则合，暗处则开，谓之羞明，此有余热在心肝也。如疮未成脓，肿去目开者，疮已过期。收靥不齐，目闭不开者，疮坏欲变。目上窜者，心绝也；直视不转者，肾绝也；非泣而泪自出者，肝绝也；微瞑者，气脱也；血贯瞳子者，火胜水竭。皆死候也。　　痘毒入眼而虚弱者，不宜凉剂，俟靥后治之。[30p]

    External Obstacles

    For children suffering from eye ailments, do not lightly use eye drops; the primary focus should be on internal medication to dispel the disease. Examine the red veins above and below, and treat according to the meridian.

    Variola Entering the Eye

    The poison of variola arises from the five viscera and six bowels, and when the poison is strong, the eyes are inevitably affected. The ancient teachings regarding eye protection are profound. If the sores are excessively out and the eyes weep constantly, this signifies liver heat. At this time, there are no visible sores in the eyes, but one should internally take medicine to purge liver fire. The variola in the eye often occurs after the facial rash is uneven. If sores enter the eye and form a cataract, do not use eye drops, as this could damage the eyes irreparably. After the variola subsides, if the eyes cannot be opened, this indicates liver heat leading to sensitivity to light; whether in bright or dim conditions, they may struggle to open. If the heart's heat encounters brightness, the eyes may close; if in darkness, they may open, creating what is known as photophobia, indicating residual heat in the heart and liver.

    If the sore has not yet formed pus and the swelling recedes allowing the eyes to open, this indicates the sore has passed its critical period. Uneven skin recovery causing the eyes to remain closed indicates the sore is deteriorating. If the eyes jerk upwards, this signifies heart failure; if they fixate without movement, this indicates kidney failure; if tears flow without crying, this suggests liver failure; slight closure indicates energy depletion; blood in the pupils indicates fire overwhelming water, all of which are fatal signs.

    For those weakened by the variola poison in the eyes, cooling agents are not advisable; one should wait until after the facial rash to treat.[30p]

    虽有目翳，切不可用点药，只宜活血解毒，俟五脏和平，翳当自去。若误用点药，则非徒无益而反害之。　　丹溪云：如痘伤眼，必用山栀、赤芍、决明、归须、连翘、防风、桔梗、升麻，小剂末之，调服。如眼无光，过百日后血气完复，则自明矣。　　张炳云：治疮疹后毒气攻眼，或生翳膜赤黑之类，宜用四物汤加荆芥、防风，煎服；兼用黑豆皮，谷精草、海蛤、甘草等分为末，用熟猪肝切片蘸服，神妙。一方治痘毒目翳，用江西蛤粉、黑豆皮、甘草、密蒙花等分为末，调服。　　丹溪云：痘后生翳，数服效，用威灵仙、仙灵脾等分，洗净，不见火与日，为细末，每服随时。　　钱氏黄蘗膏，痘初出涂面护眼；调肝散治疮疹太盛，服之不入眼。[31p]

    Although there may be vision obstruction, do not apply eye drops. It is better to invigorate the blood and resolve toxins, waiting for the five organs to restore harmony, at which point the obstruction will naturally dissipate. If mistakenly using drops, it will not only be ineffective but may cause further harm.

    Dan Xi says: If smallpox injures the eyes, one must use gardenia, red peony, cassia seed, angelica root, forsythia, siler, platycodon, and bulbus, in small doses as powder, taken as medicine. If the eyes lack brightness, after more than a hundred days when the blood and qi are restored, clarity will naturally return.

    Zhang Bing states: To treat the toxic qi attacking the eyes after a rash, or if there is a membrane of red or black, one should use Si Wu Decoction with schizonepeta and siler, decocting and taking it; also use black bean skins, plantain, sea clam, and licorice divided into powder, combining with slices of cooked pig liver dipped in, which is remarkably effective.

    A formula for treating vision obstruction caused by smallpox utilizes Jiangxi clam powder, black bean skin, licorice, and honey chrysanthemum, mixed as powder and taken as medicine.

    Dan Xi states: For vision obstruction occurring after smallpox, repeatedly taking Wei Ling Xian and Xian Ling Pi, cleaned and ground finely, without exposure to fire or sun, is recommended, taken whenever needed.

    Qian’s Huangbo ointment is to be applied to the face to protect the eyes when smallpox first erupts; the Jiaogan San is used to treat excessive rashes and should not enter the eyes.[31p]

    　　　　　痘疹余毒证

    　　痘疹为毒最重，为自禀受以来，蕴积恶毒深久之故。古称曰百岁疮，谓人生百岁之中必不能免。一发则诸经百脉清纯太和之气，皆为其扰乱一番，正气大虚而邪得以乘之，各因所犯而为疾。况目又清纯之最者，通于肝胆。肝胆为清净之府，邪正不并立。今受浊邪熏灼，则目有失发生长养之源，而病亦易侵，皆由人不能救而且害之之故也。[32p]

    Residual Toxicity from Smallpox

    Smallpox is the most severe of poisons, due to the accumulation of malevolent toxins since birth. In ancient times, it was called the "Hundred-Year Sore," as it is something that no one can avoid throughout their century of life. Once it manifests, the pure and harmonious vital energy of the body's channels and meridians is disturbed, resulting in a significant depletion of the righteous qi, allowing evil influences to take hold, each manifesting as various diseases based on what has been transgressed. Moreover, the eye, which is the clearest and most pure, is connected to the liver and gallbladder. The liver and gallbladder are the repositories of purity, where good and evil cannot coexist. When one's body is exposed to impure evils, it leads to a loss of the source of nourishment for the eyes, making them susceptible to illness; this happens because individuals are unable to rescue themselves and instead inflict harm upon themselves.[32p]

    或于病中食物太过，怀藏太暖，误投热药，多食甘酸而致病者；或于病后因虚未复，恣食辛辣燥腻，竭视劳瞻，好烘多哭，冲冒风沙烟瘴而致病者；有为昏蒙流泪之内证者；有为赤烂星障之外证者；有余邪蕴积为凝脂黄膜、花翳蟹睛等证之重而目精凸者；有余邪偶流为赤丝羞明微星薄翳等证之轻而病自消者。轻重浅深，亦各随人之犯受，所患不一。当验其证而审其经以治之，不可执一，反有激变之祸。盖痘疹之后，人同再造，比之常人不同。若有所悞，贻害终身。行斯道者，宜加谨焉。大抵治之早，则易退而无变；迟则虽无变，恐血气凝定，即易治之证亦退迟矣。今人但见痘后目疾，便谓不治。不知但瞳神不损者，纵久远亦有可治之理。惟久而血定精凝，障翳沉滑濇损者，则不治耳。　　倪仲贤云：斑疹余毒所害者，与风热不制之病稍同而异，总以羚羊角散主之；便不硬者，减硝黄。未满二十日而病作者，消毒化斑汤主之。[33p]

    Some illnesses arise from excessive consumption of food when one is unwell, retaining too much warmth, mistakenly taking hot medications, or consuming too much sweet and sour food, leading to illness. Others may become ill after recovery from an ailment, due to deficiency, overeating spicy, dry, fatty foods, overexerting oneself with excessive visual strain or crying, and exposing oneself to wind, dust, smoke, and miasmas. There may be cases of internal symptoms causing blurred vision and tearing or external symptoms like red, inflamed star-like obstructions. Some may have residual pathogenic factors that lead to conditions like fat and yellow membranes, or corneal opacities, which can result in protruding eyes. Others may have milder saline manifestations like red threads or slight haziness that resolve on their own. The severity and nature of these conditions vary from person to person and should be treated based on the specific symptoms, as blindly adhering to one approach may cause adverse reactions.

    After experiencing smallpox, a person may feel reborn, yet different from usual. If any discomfort persists, it could cause lifelong harm. Therefore, those in this field should exercise caution. Generally, treating conditions early makes recovery easier with fewer complications; if delayed, even if there are no significant changes, blood and energy may congeal, making even straightforward cases harder to remedy. People today often assume that visual disorders following smallpox cannot be treated. However, if the pupil and gaze are not affected, there may still be a chance for recovery, even after a long time. It’s only when blood has solidified and symptoms of obstruction have developed that treatment becomes infeasible.

    Ni Zhongxian states that residual toxin from rashes is somewhat similar to illnesses from unregulated wind and heat, and should be primarily treated with antler horn powder. For less severe cases, reduce the use of nitrate and yellowrye. If the illness appears within twenty days, one should apply detoxifying and rash-resolving decoctions.[33p]

    　　　　　眼疳

    　　《龙木论》：治小儿疳眼外障，此眼初患时，皆因头脑上有疮，或因经多时泻痢，潜肿疼痛，泪出难开，膈间伏热气，肝风入眼。初患此疳时，痒濇揉眉咬甲，致令翳生，赤肿疼痛，泪出难开，睑硬白睛遮满，怕日，合面卧不喜抬头。此疾不宜烧灸头面，恐损眼也。切忌点药。宜服杀疳散、退翳丸。　　《圣惠》论：夫肝开窍于目，目者肝之候。若小儿内有疳气，肌体瘦羸，而脏腑挟于风热，壅滞不得宣通，因其乳食过多，胸膈痰结，邪热之气上攻于目，则令脑热目痒，或赤烂生疮，或生障翳，渐渐遮睛，久而不瘥，损于眼目，故号眼疳也。　　《玉诀》云：此患先与凉膈，后泻肝，次淋洗之，即无误也。又云：此患小儿肝热，宜泻肝散、蕤仁膏，凉膈退热。又云：小儿疳眼，雀目斑疮入眼者，先与利膈退热凉心经，后与疳药也。[34p]

    Eye Worm

    In the "Dragon Wood Treatise": To treat the outward obstruction of children's eye worms, this condition initially arises from sores in the head and mind, or from prolonged diarrhea, which can cause hidden swelling and pain, resulting in tears that are difficult to open. Heat energy accumulates in the diaphragm, and liver wind enters the eyes. When first affected by this condition, there is itching, rubbing the eyebrows, and biting the nails, leading to the formation of opacity, redness, swelling, pain, and tears that fail to open. The eyelids become hard and the white part of the eye is covered, causing sensitivity to light; they prefer to lie down with their face covered and dislike raising their heads. This ailment is not suitable for cauterization on the head and face, fearing damage to the eyes. Avoid applying ointments. It is advisable to take medication for dispelling the worms and for resolving opacity.

    In the "Sacred Benefits Treatise": The liver opens at the eyes, and the eyes are indicators of liver health. If children have internal worm energy, their bodies become thin and weak, and due to wind and heat engulfing the organs, the flow is obstructed and cannot circulate. This is often due to excessive milk and food intake, which creates phlegm obstruction in the chest. The evil heat rises to attack the eyes, causing brain heat and itchy eyes, leading to redness, ulceration, or opacities gradually covering the vision. If left untreated for long, it damages the eyes, hence being called eye worms.

    In the "Jade Formula," it is stated: For this condition, first cool and regulate the diaphragm, then address the liver, followed by cleansing; this approach is effective. It also indicates: This condition is due to liver heat in children, and it is necessary to use liver cleansing powder and apricot kernel ointment to cool the diaphragm and reduce heat. Additionally, for children's eye worms, if there are spots and sores entering the eyes, first administer remedies to alleviate the diaphragm's heat and cool the heart, followed by worm treatment.[34p]

    　　　　　鼻病

    　　张涣云：按小儿肺气通于鼻，气为阳。若气受风寒，停滞鼻间则成鼻塞，气寒使津液不收则多涕。若冷气久不散，脓涕结聚，使鼻不闻香臭，则成齆鼻。若挟热则鼻干。皆妨害乳食。
    　　　　　鼻塞

    　　演山云：凡牙儿鼻塞，宜以通关膏敷之，消风散服之。通关膏用白僵蚕、猪牙皂角、荆芥、香附子、川芎、细辛等分为末，葱白同研，敷顖至妙。
    　　　　　鼻流清涕

    　　《圣惠》云：肺气通于鼻，若其脏为风冷所伤，冷随气乘于鼻，故使液涕不收也。夫津液涕唾，得热则干燥，得冷则流溢也。
    　　　　　鼻干无涕

    　　《圣惠》云：小儿肺脏壅滞，有积热上攻于脑，则令脑热也。又肺气通于鼻，主于涕。若其脏脊热，则津液干燥，故令无涕也。[35p]

    Nasal Disease

    Zhang Huan said: In children, lung qi connects to the nose, and qi represents the yang. If this qi is harmed by wind-cold, it stagnates in the nose, leading to nasal congestion; cold qi prevents the fluids from being retained, resulting in excessive nasal discharge. If cold air lingers, purulent discharge accumulates, causing an inability to smell, which leads to a condition known as "malodorous nose." If there is accompanying heat, the nose becomes dry. All these conditions impede the digestion of milk and food.

    Nasal Congestion

    Yan Shan said: If a child has nasal congestion, it is advisable to apply Tongguan ointment and take dispersing medicine. The Tongguan ointment is made from white silkworms, pig's tooth soap, schizonepeta, cyperus, chuanxiong, and asarum, ground into powder, mixed with the white part of scallions, and applied to the forehead for efficacy.

    Clear Nasal Discharge

    The "Shenghui" states: Lung qi connects to the nose; if the internal organs are harmed by wind-cold, the cold follows the qi into the nose, preventing the retention of fluids, resulting in nasal discharge. Fluids like saliva and mucus, when exposed to heat, become dry; when exposed to cold, they overflow.

    Dry Nose with No Discharge

    The "Shenghui" states: When a child’s lungs are obstructed, with accumulated heat attacking upward towards the brain, it causes heat in the brain. Since lung qi connects to the nose and is responsible for mucus, if the organs are hot, the fluids become dry, leading to a lack of discharge.[35p]

    　　　　　鼻有息肉

    　　《千金翼》论曰：凡人往往有鼻中肉塞，眠食皆不快利。得鼻中出息，而俗方亦众，而用之皆无成效。惟见《本草》云：雄黄主鼻中息肉，此言不虚。但时人不知用雄黄之法，医者生用，故致困毙。曾有一人患鼻不得喘息，余以成炼雄黄，日内一大枣许大，过十日，肉塞自出，当时即得喘息，更不重发。　　其炼雄黄法，在《千金翼》仙丹方中具有之，宜寻求也。
    　　　　　耳聋

    　　张涣曰：小儿耳中诸病，由风入于脑，停积于手太阳之脉则令耳聋，风与湿相搏则两耳生疮。又儿稍大，见月初生，以手指之，则耳下生疮者，名月蚀疮。又乳母与儿洗浴，悞令水入耳中，水湿停积，搏于血气，蕴结成脓，谓之聤耳。　　《宝鉴》歌云：太阳入耳损听聪，气滞时多耳必聋。鸣是风并气相击，痛应脑户有邪风。肾热郁蒸聤耳患，日深疼痛出稠脓。不有稠脓非此患，只因滴水入其中。[36p]

    Nasal Polyps

    The "Qianjin Yi" states: People often have flesh obstructing their noses, which affects their sleeping and eating. There are many folk remedies for nasal discharge, yet they are all ineffective. Only "Bencao" mentions that realgar is for nasal polyps, which is true. However, contemporaries do not know how to use realgar; when practitioners use it incorrectly, it leads to complications. There was once a person who could not breathe through the nose, and I processed realgar, approximately the size of a large jujube, and after ten days, the obstruction resolved, allowing for breathing to resume without recurrence. The method of processing realgar is mentioned in the "Qianjin Yi" in the elixir formulas, and it should be sought after.

    Hearing Loss

    Zhang Huan says: In children, ear diseases arise when wind enters the brain and stagnates in the hand's Taiyang meridian, causing hearing loss. When wind and dampness clash, sores appear in both ears. When a child grows a little older and sees the new moon and points at it, sores may appear beneath the ears, known as moon eclipse sores. When a wet nurse bathes a child and mistakenly allows water to enter the ears, the moisture accumulates, clashing with the blood and qi, forming pus, which is called otorrhea. The "Baojian" rhyme goes: "When wind enters the ear, hearing is damaged; when qi is stagnant, hearing loss is certain. Ringing indicates that wind and qi clash, and pain suggests that there is evil wind in the brain. Heat in the kidneys steams and causes hearing issues; the pain deepens, producing thick pus. If there is no thick pus, it is not this illness, but rather due to water dripping inside."[36p]

    　　　　　耳聋

    　　巢氏云：手太阳之经入于耳内，头脑有风，入乘其脉，与气相搏，故令耳聋。
    　　　　　耳鸣

    　　巢氏云：邪气与正气相搏，故令耳鸣；久即邪气停滞，遂成聋也。
    　　　　　聤耳

    　　巢氏云：耳宗脉之所聚，肾气之所通。小儿肾脏盛而有热者，热气上冲于耳，津液壅结，即生脓汁；亦有因沐浴水入耳中而不倾沥令尽，水湿停积，搏于血气，蕴结成热，亦令脓汁出，皆谓之聤耳。久不瘥，即变成聋也。
    　　　　医学入门 【明　李梴】

    　　　　　解颅

    　　解颅原是肾家虚。
    　　小儿年大，头缝开解而不合，宜肾气丸，或八物畅加酒炒芩、连；外用南星白蔹为末，醋调摊红帛上，烘热贴之。或虎头骨烧灰，油调敷缝中，外作头布遮护。其父母宜服肾气丸、虎潜丸，俾精血充足，后育子女无是患也。[37p]

    Deafness

    Chao states: The hand of the solar meridian enters the ear; when wind enters the head, it travels along the channels, colliding with the qi, which causes deafness.

    Otitis

    Chao states: The ear is where the ancestral meridian converges and where the kidney qi flows. In children, if the kidneys are abundant and possess heat, this heat qi rushes upwards to the ear, causing fluids to become stagnated, leading to the production of pus. Also, if water enters the ear during bathing and is not thoroughly drained, the moisture may accumulate, interfere with the blood qi, and generate heat, resulting in pus as well. This condition is referred to as otitis. If it endures and does not heal, it may turn into deafness.

    Introduction to Medicine (Ming, Li Zhan)

    Cranial Relief

    Cranial relief is primarily due to deficiency in the kidney system. In older children, if the head seams remain open and do not close properly, it is advisable to use kidney qi pills, or the Eight Treasure Formula combined with wine, cooked with rhizome and lotus. Externally, powdered nanshing and white lance can be mixed with vinegar, spread on red silk, heated, and applied. Alternatively, burning tiger skull bones into ash and mixing with oil can be applied to the seams, with a head covering for protection. Parents should take kidney qi pills and tiger tranquilizing pills to ensure sufficient essence and blood, preventing such issues in future offspring.[37p]

    　　　　　顖填顖陷

    　　风热顖填脾亏陷。
    　　顖填者，肝气盛风热冲上而成此候也。《玉环集》歌曰：顖门肿起定为风，此候应医也不中。若或加坑如盏足，七日之间命必终。
    　　　　医学准绳六要 【明　张三锡】
    　　　　　斑后翳膜遮睛

    　　海藏云：东垣治斑后风热余毒，翳膜气障遮睛，以泻青丸治之，大效。《保命集》云：退翳膜妙，不特斑后减大黄服。余以为肝经久蕴风热，乃生翳膜，泻青丸正所以拔病根也。　　小儿斑疹后毒上攻于目，翳膜肿痛，脉实强壮能食者，羚羊角散加减以解之。气血虚而胃弱者，须以补养为先，而佐以解毒，斯得之矣。丹溪曰：犀角性升散，较诸角尤甚，痘后有余毒者用之。如无余毒，虚虚之祸，如指诸掌，不可不知。[38p]

    Head Swelling and Depression

    Wind-heat leads to head swelling and spleen deficiency. Head swelling occurs when liver qi is strong and wind-heat surges upward to create this condition. The "Yuhuan Collection" states: when the head gate swells, it is certainly due to wind, and this condition should be treated but is not serious. If it develops into a pit-like form, within seven days, life is surely at risk.

    Medical Principles: Six Essentials [Ming Dynasty, Zhang Sanxi]

    Post-Lesion Opacity Obscuring Vision

"Baoming Collection" states: for removing the membrane, it is effective to not only reduce with Da Huang but also to treat the root cause. I believe that prolonged retention of wind-heat in the liver channel leads to the formation of the membrane, and Qingshan Pills are indeed used to address the root of the disease. For children whose rash aftermath leads to upward attack on the eyes, causing membrane swelling and pain, with a strong pulse and good appetite, use a modified version of the antelope horn powder to resolve it. For those with qi and blood deficiency and weak stomachs, it is essential to prioritize nourishment, supplemented with detoxification, to achieve success.
